Ceremonial Pillars can be found inside the Graveyard of Heroes inside Shayzien. A larger one can be found east of the graveyard with an old man staring at it.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

The smaller pillars in the graveyard contain Japanese phrases, which are turned upside down.

  • "彼が死んだ" - "He died."
  • "猿も木から落ちる" - "Even monkeys fall from trees." (a Japanese proverb)

The larger monument is mixed with Traditional and Simplified Chinese words, which are also turned upside down.

  • "一騎当千万式戦争" - "One rider can battle in thousands upon thousands of battles."
  • The phrase could also be translated as "A style of war where a single rider equals thousands upon thousands."

'''Ceremonial Pillars''' can be found inside the [[Graveyard of Heroes]] inside [[Shayzien]]. A larger one can be found east of the graveyard with an [[old man (Shayzien)|old man]] staring at it.

==Trivia==
The smaller pillars in the graveyard contain Japanese phrases, which are turned upside down.
* "彼が死んだ" - "He died."
* "猿も木から落ちる" - "Even monkeys fall from trees." (a Japanese proverb)
The larger monument is mixed with Traditional and Simplified Chinese words, which are also turned upside down.
* "一騎当千万式戦争" - "One rider can battle in thousands upon thousands of battles."
* The phrase could also be translated as "A style of war where a single rider equals thousands upon thousands."

{{Shayzien}}
